Post.title: Angular  ui-router
Post._content:
UI-RouterAngular-UIng-routeui-router #### ng-route - $scope - URL #### ui-router - "$state"\$stateURL - web > ui-router [ui-router](http://angular-ui.github.io/ui-router/site/#/api/ui.router)http://angular-ui.github.io/ui-router/site/#/api/ui.router #### 1.index.htmlangular.jsui-routerui-router.js ``` ``` 2. ``` var app = angular.module('routerApp', ['ui.router']); ``` 3.htmlui-view$statetemplate 4.ui-srefui-sref=$stateabuttonui-viewhtmlui-view 5.js #### ``` app.config(function ($stateProvider, $urlRouterProvider) { $urlRouterProvider.when("", "/page1"); $stateProvider .state('page1', { url: '/page1', templateUrl:'viewpage1.html', }).state('page2', { url: '/page2', templateUrl:'view/page2.html', }) }) ``` url - statepage1,page2 - urlxx.com/index.html/urltemplate -"template"Html"templateUrl" ``` $stateProvider.state('contacts', { templateUrl: function (stateParams){ return '/partials/contacts.' + stateParams + '.html'; } }) ``` #### ui-sref \page1\view/page1.htmlindex.htmlviewindex.html,login.html - $state.go()ui-routerjs ``` $state.go('page1'); // $state.go('page1l', {pageId: 15}); // /page1/42 ``` - url #### view/openResume.htmlview/resumeList.html view/resemeList.html ``` ``` ``` state('openResume', { url: '/openResume/{resumeId}', templateUrl:function($stateParams){ console.log($stateParams); return 'view/openResume.html' } }) ``` ![](http://o7ts2uaks.bkt.clouddn.com/001.png) console ![](http://o7ts2uaks.bkt.clouddn.com/QQ%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%8720151222154531.png) ~ #### ui-routerng-router**** page1-main.html index.html\page1 page1.html\page1-main ``` .state('page1',{ url : '/page1', templateUrl : 'view/page1.html' }) .state('page1.main',{ url : '/main', emplateUrl : 'view/page1-main.html' }) ``` ui-routerpage1-main #### ui-router$state ```
``` ``` $stateProvider.state("home", { views: { "": { template: "

HELLO!

" }, "chart": { template: "" }, "data": { template: "" } } }) ```

HELLO!

" }, "chart": { template: "" }, "data": { template: "" } } }) ```

Post.title: Viewport-Percentage (or Viewport-Relative) Lengths
Post._content:
### viewport-percentage lengths W3C >The viewport-percentage lengths are relative to the size of the initial containing block. When the height or width of the initial containing block is changed, they are scaled accordingly. `initial containing block``window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight` `vh` (), `vw`(), `vmin` () and `vmax` (vw) ### `vh`: `1vh`1%DOM100vh ### ![caniuse](http://o7ts2uaks.bkt.clouddn.com/98A8FA40-23DE-4D3B-AE9B-A434F44A5AA0.png) css[caniuse](http://caniuse.com/#search=viewport%20units)**Chrome 20+, IE9+ ,FireFox19+Safari6** ### 100vh100% vh100vh`window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight` ```

Hello, world!

``` p100div200pxp200px ### vh `vw`, `vh``%``absolute/fixed` ``` { position: fixed; top: 100%; top: 100vh; left: 5%; left: 5vw; right: 5%; right: 5vw; } ``` vh, vw% ### * [James Donnelly__stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1575141/make-div-100-height-of-browser-window): * [_](http://www.zhangxinxu.com/wordpress/2012/09/new-viewport-relative-units-vw-vh-vm-vmin/): * [JS,Jquery](http://www.cnblogs.com/xiaopin/archive/2012/03/26/2418152.html):

When the height or width of the initial containing block is changed, they are scaled accordingly. `initial containing block``window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight` `vh` (), `vw`(), `vmin` () and `vmax` (vw) ### `vh`: `1vh`1%DOM100vh ### ![caniuse](http://o7ts2uaks.bkt.clouddn.com/98A8FA40-23DE-4D3B-AE9B-A434F44A5AA0.png) css[caniuse](http://caniuse.com/#search=viewport%20units)**Chrome 20+, IE9+ ,FireFox19+Safari6** ### 100vh100% vh100vh`window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight` ```

### git rebase
`git rebase``git merge`


>D---E master
     /
A---B---C---F origin/master

merge

>D--------E  
     /          \
A---B---C---F----G   master, origin/master

rebase

>A---B---C---F---D'---E'   master, origin/master

rebasegit mergerebasegit log

### A rebase-based workflow
1.

> git checkout master
  git pull    #master
  git checkout master -b test   #masterfeature
  git push -u origin test:test
  \#push-uset-upstream-to 

2.

master

> git pull --rebase origin master #master

test

> git pull --rebase #

3.

> git checkout master
  git pull     #merge commit
  git rebase test     #commits
  git push

### pr
prmergecommitcherry-pick

> git fetch origin master:new-feature
  git checkout new-feature
  git cherry-pick COMMIT_HASH_1
  git cherry-pick COMMIT_HASH_2
  ...
  git cherry-pick COMMIT_HASH_N
  
cherry-pick""
